intro: Tithymalus tommasinianus, commonly known as the Italian tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Tithymalus tommasinianus is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its delicate foliage and fragrant blooms.
